definition: to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)

sentences.english: Eg:Book early if you want to be sure of a seat .
sentences.chinese: 要想十拿九稳有个座位，那就早订座。

sentences.english: Government officials said the move shows the project is stable.
sentences.chinese: 政府官员称上述行动显示该项目已经十拿九稳。

sentences.english: Perhaps he considered himself a shoo-in.
sentences.chinese: 或许他认为自己会十拿九稳。
当然，没有任何事是十拿九稳的。

sentences.english: This time the opportunity presented what he fatuously termed to himself a "cinch."
sentences.chinese: 这一次出现的机会极为难得，他满以为十拿九稳哩。

definition: grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
that clinches it/that's final/no two ways about it
a sure gain/sth one is sure to obtain
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
lit. Cheng Yaojin ambushes the enemy (saying)/fig. sb shows up unexpectedly and disrupts the plan/sb whose presence is regarded as irksome
pinyin: ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1

definition: to come as no surprise/as expected
